meanings.definition: To make or become faster or more rapid.
meanings.sent1: She quickened her pace to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The horse quickened its speed as it approached the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The music quickened her heartbeat with its lively rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The news of the approaching storm quickened their preparations.
meanings.sent5: The urgency of the situation quickened their decision-making process.

meanings.sent1: The surprise party quickened her spirits.
meanings.sent2: His words quickened her interest in the subject.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist quickened the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: The challenge of the puzzle quickened his mind.
meanings.sent5: The adventure novel quickened her imagination.

meanings.definition: To come to life or become alive.
meanings.sent1: The garden quickened with the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The patient's pulse quickened after waking up from surgery.
meanings.sent3: The old house quickened with the laughter of children playing.
meanings.sent4: The city quickened at night with the glow of lights.
meanings.sent5: The forest quickened with the sounds of awakening wildlife.
